title: Fixes for iOS fix breaking Android
message:
Fixes for iOS fix breaking Android

QSize in Android and iOS seems to mean very different things when applied to the QListWidget::gridSize. Since we're content with the Android layout I'm leaving it as is. A preprocessor directive switches using QListWidget::setGridSize based on if IOS_SPECIFIC is set. If it is not a Null QSize is set instead.

title: Commit of crashy branch.
message:
Commit of crashy branch.

There's a race condition when sync is running that seems to cause multiple threads to attempt to write to the mainWindow's statusBar at the same time.

QObject::killTimer: Timers cannot be stopped from another thread
QObject::startTimer: Timers cannot be started from another thread
QPainter::begin: A paint device can only be painted by one painter at a time.
QPainter::setCompositionMode: Painter not active
QWidget::repaint: Recursive repaint detected
QWidget::paintEngine: Should no longer be called
QPainter::begin: Paint device returned engine == 0, type: 1
QWidget::repaint: Recursive repaint detected
QPainter::begin: A paint device can only be painted by one painter at a time.
QPainter::setCompositionMode: Painter not active
The program has unexpectedly finished.

message:

title: Handle multiple invertebrates using the same image
message: Handle multiple invertebrates using the same image

title: Implement a settings view
message:
Implement a settings view

SettingsView now controls when sync can be done
Sync settings have a place holder with possible values of:
	Manual only (which is the only thing that works the way you'd expect)
	Auto sync on startup
	Auto sync (WiFi)
Last Sync date time is recorded and displayed to the user

Other Things:

The application no longer auto syncs on start up
Sync can now safely be stopped mid-process, including interupting a running HTTP get request
Application now has a destructor to ensure that the views (which are now pointers) are deleted. As an aside this means that we now could support deleting views that are not currently open.
Local data is properly locked while it is being updated
The move, resize, show and hiding calls in the transition handlers have been moved into a reusable method
Conversion to double failures in the StreamHandler explicitly set lat/lon to 0.0
About text that is updated from the server is persisted to settings
About syncing has been moved into its own method
Removed missing Gumbo headers from the .pro file

title: Add updating of about text from URL
message:
Add updating of about text from URL

Adds Google Gumbo and a C++ wrapper for Gumbo to handle parsing the about text

title: Fixes
message:
Fixes

Removed redundant code in Application::transitionInvertebrateToSingleStream (there's no need to rebuild the stream view when we're coming back to the same stream we just left)

Removed double click handler for StreamView

title: Support stopping the application while the update process is running
message:
Support stopping the application while the update process is running

Add a stop signal connected to the application's aboutToQuit signal that connects to the WebDataSynchronizer's isOk flag, and includs checks throughout the Synchronizer to return if isOk becomes false.

title: Fix image batching and possible memory leaks
message:
Fix image batching and possible memory leaks

All the QNetworkReplys now are wrapped into QScopedPointers that call deleteLater when they go out of scope

title: Fixes for image description
message:
Fixes for image description

The regular expression that matched the description when it does not have a <!--Stop--> marker only captured a single character.
Another regex has been added to extract the text from Wiki-style links and replace the links in the invertebrate description.

title: Implemented non-authenticated batching of API use

title: Added a trimmed to the invertebrate description
message: Added a trimmed to the invertebrate description

title: Fixes to syncing and invertebrate display
message:
Fixes to syncing and invertebrate display

Since the invertebrate view is being reused and not created and destroyed it is necessary to explicitly set the placeholder image, otherwise invertebrates lacking images of their own would show the last image.

Parsing date time formats is a pain. Image uniqueness and up-to-dateness is ensured by using a hash of the URL and the SHA1 returned by the server. This will ensure that unique entries will be generated for each unique combination of those two attributes, which may result in the device holding more images than necessary, but will also provide safety from name collisions. e.g. http://domain.org/bug_pic.jpg and http://place.org/bug_pic.jpg

title: Allowed single click to activate streams/invertebrates
message: Allowed single click to activate streams/invertebrates

title: Improved QDebug implmentation for Invertebrate
message:
Improved QDebug implmentation for Invertebrate

As a result I've discovered that the ETag might not be as reliable a method of uniquely recognizing images as I'd hoped. I'm now thinking about moving to a date/time. I do like using a hash of the name instead of the oddball names that we start with.

title: Synchronized URL getting
message:
Synchronized URL getting

URL getting asynchronously between threads is problematic, so for now work synchronously.
Fix for Invertebrate descriptions not having a STOP marker specified breaking the regex

title: Moved construction of the network access manager into the run method
message:
Moved construction of the network access manager into the run method

The run method is the first part of the object that is executed in the new thread, and seems like a safe location.

title: Finished non-functional implementation of WebDataSynchronizer
message:
Finished non-functional implementation of WebDataSynchronizer

The program compiles and runs, but the attempt to use the QThreadPool results in an error:
QObject: Cannot create children for a parent that is in a different thread.
(Parent is QNetworkAccessManager(0x7ff7c1d4e548), parent's thread is QThread(0x7ff7c1e02530), current thread is QThread(0x7ff7c1d3fcf0)

A quick look at Stack suggests greater reliance on Signals/Slots.

title: Moving DataManager's remaining functions into Application
message: Moving DataManager's remaining functions into Application

title: More work on async
message:
More work on async

Hurray for c++11 lambda-syntax; thanks to the new syntax we can finally connect QNetworkReplys directly to their handlers. This lets us have numerous requests running in parallel.
